alert.note: Alert for Ford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 7:36PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Ford County through 830 PM CDT... At 736 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ft. Dodge, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. Accumulating hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Hail may accumulate on roadways causing hazardous travel and reduced visibility owing to hail fog. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Ford County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
